message.content: This question requires knowledge about the process used to make dairy products safe for consumption. Pasteurization is the process of heating milk or other dairy products to kill harmful bacteria and pathogens. It helps to extend the shelf life of dairy products and make them safe to consume. Options (A), (B), and (C) are not related to the process of making dairy edible. Mixing, boiling, and freezing do not address the issue of bacteria and pathogens in dairy products.

This question requires basic knowledge about the process of making dairy safe for consumption. Dairy products can contain harmful bacteria and pathogens that can make humans sick. In order to make dairy edible, it needs to undergo the process of pasteurization. Pasteurization involves heating the dairy product to a specific temperature for a certain amount of time to kill off any harmful bacteria, while still preserving its nutritional value. Option (A) is incorrect because simply mixing dairy products would not eliminate harmful bacteria. Option (B) is incorrect because boiling alone may not be sufficient to kill off all pathogens. Option (C) is incorrect because freezing would not effectively eliminate harmful bacteria.

This question requires knowledge about the processing of dairy products to make them safe for consumption. Dairy contains bacteria and other microorganisms that can potentially make humans sick. To make dairy edible, it needs to undergo the process of pasteurization. Pasteurization is the heating of the dairy product to a specific temperature and then rapidly cooling it to kill harmful bacteria while preserving the taste and nutritional value of the product.

Option (A) mixing is incorrect because simply mixing dairy does not remove harmful bacteria. Option (B) boiling is not specific enough as simply boiling dairy may not achieve the necessary temperature to kill all bacteria. Option (C) freezing does not kill bacteria, it only slows down their growth. Option (D) pasteurization is the correct answer because it is the specific process used to make dairy safe for consumption by killing harmful bacteria.

To make dairy products edible and safe for consumption, they undergo a process called pasteurization. Pasteurization involves heating the dairy product to a specific temperature to kill harmful bacteria and pathogens, while still preserving the nutritional value of the product. Option (A) is incorrect because simply mixing dairy does not make it safe for consumption. Option (B) is incorrect because boiling is not sufficient to effectively eliminate harmful microorganisms. Option (C) is incorrect because freezing does not kill bacteria, it only slows down their growth.
